project.teaser: SteamDry develops and pilots superheated steam drying technology (SSD) for weblike materials such as paper, board, tissue, and nonwovens. SSD is expected to reduce the consumption of energy radically, leading to 60% energy savings in a drying process, representing ~40% energy...
project.objective:
SteamDry develops and pilots superheated steam drying technology (SSD) for weblike materials such as paper, board, tissue, and nonwovens. SSD is expected to reduce the consumption of energy radically, leading to 60% energy savings in a drying process, representing ~40% energy savings on the entire production line. It also demonstrates a concept that can lead to CO2 emission-free paper and board manufacturing, and an increase in the share of renewable energy. In a long term, the energy savings potential in Europe is 127 TWh or 6 B€ annually for paper and board manufacturers. In addition to pulp and paper sectors, the developed concepts are expected to be suitable for chemical industry and wood processing applications. Through the developed SteamDry concept, the technology suppliers can increase their market share revenue 230-345 M€ annually in Europe. The global annual energy savings potential is 870 TWh, almost 7x of European energy savings and market potential.
The developed solution can be installed on either existing infrastructure or on newbuilt machines with low CAPEX and OPEX creating new opportunities for technology suppliers and savings for the users of this technology. Results ultimately lead to the prosperity of these companies and the CO2-savings targets of the EU. Exploitation potential will be validated through the business cases calculated by technology suppliers and product manufacturers.
The piloting of SSD increases knowledge of a) keeping two gas phases, air and steam, separate, b) cleaning superheated steam from biobased particles, c) operating these safely and d) AI-supported advanced control platform.
This approach builds on the consortium with strong capabilities to perform the action. The consortium consists of four R&D institutes and two universities - with piloting, technology upscaling, AI, and modeling expertise - two leading technology suppliers and five product manufacturers that are potential end users for the developed technology.
project.title: Superheated steam drying for sustainable and recyclable web-like materials
project.keywords: drying, superheated steam drying, papermaking, technology development, piloting

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SteamDry (Superheated steam drying for sustainable and recyclable web-like materials)
result.teaser: The SteamDry project aims to develop and pilot innovative superheated steam drying (SSD) technologies for web-like materials such as paper, board, tissue, and nonwovens. The primary goal is to significantly reduce the CO2 footprint of the paper and pulp industry by enhancing...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Quality Management Plan QMP
result.description: Internal procedures for communication, progress monitoring, quality assurance and risk management. A written document that defines the project’s objectives, documentation, responsibilities,and accountability as it relates to project quality and outlines how the project team will implement,perform, and measure those policies. Document saved in SteamDry-portal and shared with partners. Task 1.1

result.title: SteamDry IT concept
result.description: Concept for data collection and storage, application of digital twin, models and automation solution. For the application of the digital twins and distributed agent platform to the paper drying process results from previous HORIZON projects will be considered. The necessary IT concept provided in D8.1 will contain each a list of available and required process and product measurements, an estimation of the amount of collected data together with a storage solution (e.g. type of database, required storage and data transfer capacity). The technology for the implementation of the models, the data transport as well as user interface will be selected.

result.title: Vision roadmap of SSD transition
result.description: Roadmap of transition of different dryers in PPI. A report describing the dryer types that are used in PPI. Estimate for process and dryer changes and their technical complexity needed for the SSD modification. Identification of possible reuse options for steam generated by SSD. Task 3.1

result.title: Ethics Plan
result.description: Plan for the management and monitoring of ethics issues during the project implementation. A report describing and monitoring that the relevant ethics regulations and procedures are followed in all project activities. Guidelines for handling the ethical issues within the consortium. Task 1.3

result.title: Design of a separation system for the closed-loop superheated steam drying process in the paper industry

details.authors: de Oliveira, Felipe; Meinders, Marcel; Zondervan, Edwin

result.title: Initial communication materials for rising awareness
result.description: Report summarizing the first awareness campaign, communication activities and materials. This deliverable (M12) will include all communication activities and tools used to introduce and raise awareness on SteamDry project, during the first year of the project, including first awareness campaign, communication activities and materials (introductory video; first press release; initial newsletter; first brochure; project infographic describing SteamDry integrated concept -WP3-). D13.2 is an output of T13.1, T13.2 and an input for D14.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
